page.title: 16RECREATION, KIRKBY UNDERWOOD
page.content: Being a rural area recreation/leisure lends itself to country sports and pursuits such as hunting, shooting, walking and horse-riding. Temple Wood is good for walking as is neighbouring Callan Lane Wood which has waymarked walks and a picnic area. Bird watching and nature study are also held in these woods. The area is hunted by the Belvoir Hunt and there are pheasant, pigeon and rabbit shoots during the season. Kirkby Underwood has a flourishing Women's Institute which holds monthly meetings in the village hall; at present there are eighteen members. Bourne Kart Club holds monthly meetings during the summer at a grass track on land owned by Mr.Green of Kirkby Underwood, as do a group of archers, the Robin Hood Society, who exercise in Temple Wood.
